intro: Diastema gymnoleuca, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in spikelets, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Diastema gymnoleuca thrives in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and marshes. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various insect species.
